page.title: 09ENVILLE'S FARM,MORETON
page.content: Enville's Farm is a part of Ongar Farms Ltd..The whole farm covers 800 acres,3 of which are taken up with Greens Vineyard. 100 acres is oilseed rape,100 acres barley,510 acres wheat and 42 acres grassland.The balance is deciduous woodland,farmyards and roads. The crops are rotated every 7 years.The average size of field is 60-70 acres. The farm also buys beef cattle in the spring, grazes them through the summer,and then sells them in the autumn for meat.They are mostly Herefords and Fresians. The earth is heavy boulder clay, which is an orange/brown colour. Underneath the clay is chalk. The meadow fields have been kept as grassland as the soil is too rich for crops.The rainfall is 20-23 inches, which is low.
